inn1.comm: sluggish track, as evident by the lack of timing from Akmal, the ball was short and a bit wide but came on slow and the batsman chopped it to cover
on the pads and Jamshed opens his account with a whippish shot
again too wide but Akmal mistimes the slap straight to point
a bit fuller and Akmal leans into a push square on the off side
takes a step down the track and lofts a straighter ball over midwicket
again Akmal takes a stroll down the track and this time slashes a fuller, wider delivery over backward point and on the bounce to the fielder at third man
pitches outside leg, stays low, Akmal turns it toward square leg
pitched up three feet outside off stump and a wide is called
better ball, fullish length and on the stumps and Jamshed defends

edged and taken at first slip! Poor shot from Jamshed, feet not moving as he fishes at a full delivery outside off stump, a real sucker of a shot, and Samaraweera gobbles it up in his lap, that was real catching practice
slower ball, pitched up just outside off stump, wobbles off the seam, stays a tad low and Younis opts to leave it be for the wicketkeeper
pitches back of a length marginally outside leg stump and Younis gets up to defend the ball down
fuller ball, pitches wide of off stump and then deviates even further and a wide is called, so now we see a bit of sharp movement off the track
back of a length and it forces Younis onto the back foot, he spars at the ball and it turns toward midwicket, prompting the batsmen to steal a quick single
pitches middle and off and seams back in and Younis works it off the stumps wide of square leg and midwicket, Akmal is forceful in calling for the second
good seam-up delivery, lands just around off stump and shapes away and Younis has to get over the ball and watchfully push it to the off side
wider one this time and he plants the back leg across off stump and slashes at the ball, edging it safely between gully and the slips for a single
good length ball outside off, he's cramped for room as he drives off the back foot and the result is an inside edge to the on side
just back of a length, Akmal starts coming forward but then waits and nearly gets squared up but does well to adjust the soft hands and push the ball to  point
better ball, stump-to-stump stuff and Akmal watchfully defends
short of a length on the body, Younis waits and taps it back to Thushara
much wider and needs to be dispatched but Younis mistimes the cut, basically he goes to hard at the ball, and toe-ends the ball to Kapugedera at point
now his timing improves and he back-cuts the ball for a single
straighter ball, pitching just around leg stump, Akmal defends it back
very well bowled, a seam-up delivery on middle and leg and Akmal has to hurry onto the back foot to present a full face of the bat
strays down the pads, Akmal brushes it wide of square leg for two
pitches full just outside off stump, cuts back in, Younis is alert and gently pushes the ball down the track wide of Akmal and urges the quick single
good length, no room on offer, Akmal gets back and defends solidly
ah, streaky shot over cover! Akmal spoons a full and wide ball just over the fingers of Matthews, it was a loose shot but he managed to get enough elevation
back of a length and Younis gets back to push the ball to cover
another loose shot, this time from Younis, who pushes forward at a full ball just outside off stump and is done in by the movement, getting an inside edge to leg
pitches on middle and off and seams away ever so gently and Akmal, already committed onto the front foot, pushes at it and squirts the ball to cover
not a bad ball at all, just back of a length and angling across Younis but he plays a gem of a shot, waiting on the back foot and forcing the ball past extra cover
much fuller just outside off stump, Younis just thuds forward with bat and pad, the ball strikes the flap first and the Sri Lankan get exited but Asoka de Silva is unmoved, reckoning it was too high
back of a length and forced off the back foot to cover
punches this one off the back foot and Mathews cuts it off at cover
good ball, lands on leg stump and cramps Younis so he defends
good end to the over, pitches leg stump and angles across, Younis gets into line and defends the ball awkwardly to the off side
there's a shot! Kulasekera drops short on the stumps and in a flash Akmal swivels onto the pull shot, connects well and gets a one-bounce four over midwicket
good shot again, the length is fuller but not full enough and Akmal plays a firm drive on the move between the men at cover
straighter ball, Akmal moves across his stumps and drives to midwicket
slower ball, fullish outside off stump, Akmal picks it and waits and then turns the bat face to steer a single down to third man, very smart batting from him
a Michael Vaughan shot, when he had the full services of both legs! Marginally short ball on the stumps and Younis is quick to get up on one leg and tennis-bat the ball wide of midwicket for four
pitched up this time outside off stump, Younis eases into a front-foot drive but gets an inside edge instead
pitched up outside off stump with the angle, Akmal dabs it to point
good shot on the rise from Akmal, just uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball and drives it past extra cover and mid-off, a really pleasing boundary there
better ball, change of pace, pitches on leg stump and angles across, Akmal gets behind the line and defends
back of a length, Akmal drives off the back foot and Samaraweera at short cover flings himself to his right and saves runs, an athletic effort from him
another slow ball, lands just outside leg stump, Akmal defends
slower ball once more, outside leg stump, turned to midwicket
short of a length outside off stump, Younis drives off the back foot but mistimes the shot to short cover
leans forward to a full ball and steers the ball to backward point

full on the stumps, swings back in sharply, Younis lunges at the ball and gets a thin inside edge as he flicks, the ball goes past square leg, the batsmen run one then call for a second but then Akmal stumbles as he turns, then has to scramble back and sticks the bat across the line as Sangakkara takes the ball
pitched up and driven straight to short cover, looks like Matthews
another good short-arm-jab from Akmal, just picks the length and dumps it high over midwicket, the ball just sits up and asks to be smacked
now he flashes at one pitched up wide and fails to get bat on ball
pitched up on middle and leg and Younis defends it back
shuffles around, Thushara sees him on the move and fires the ball in full outside the pads, Younis scoops it and nearly gives a diving midwicket a catch
banged in shorter and wider and this time no shot offered

full ball outside off stump sucks Younis into an airy drive away from the body and the result is a loose shot that is edged between gully and the slips and the outfield is so fast that third man cannot cut it off
sweet shot this time from Younis, meeting the full ball on off stump with a full face and straight bat and the ball speeds past the bowler and mid-off
pitches outside leg stump, turned straight to midwicket
starts off full and angling it into Akmal, who drives loosely and gets a leading edge that does not carry to the man stationed at cover
good seam movement from Fernando, pitches it up outside off stump and lures Akmal out of his crease, he pushes loosely and gets beaten all ends up
short ball on leg stump, Akmal hops across his crease and gets a faint tickle on the ball and it runs down to fine leg, so thats the 50-run stand as well
back to full this time and Akmal drives hard, looking to go past cover, but he gets an inside edge down to deep backward square leg instead
full outside off stump, Younis punches off the back foot for one
beaten on the flirt outside off stump, he reaches out and fishes at a shorter ball and cannot connect
full ball on off stump, Younis presses forward and plays it back
shorter ball and this time he slashes it off one leg past cover
change of pace, holds back the length and runs the fingers over the seam, getting the ball to deviate away from Akmal but he smartly guides it past gully
back of a length and Younis hops back to push the ball to cover
low full toss on the stumps, he flicks but can't beat midwicket
good ball to end the over, very straight and full and Younis defends
back of a length on middle and leg, Akmal goes back and defends
shorter in length and steered off the back foot wide of gully
fuller this time, Younis commits himself to the front foot and then defends with a slight turn of the wrists, manufacturing an easy single down to third man
full on off stump, Akmal drives straight back to Fernando
good shot but just the single, Akmal leans into a full ball and drives past cover out to the sweeper in the deep
short of a length on middle and leg, forcing Younis onto the back foot
full outside leg stump, Akmal walks across the sticks and then chips the ball wide of midwicket, making sure to roll the wrists
short of a length and angling away, brings the ball back and he defends
very full and he drives to short cover, where there's a misfield
bouncer this time, a surprise delivery, pitches wide and then deviates wider to get the keeper diving to save runs, wide is the call
struggles for timing, getting back to try and hammer a short ball away on the off side but succeeding in chopping it to cover
slower ball, full on the pads, clipped wide of mid-on, calls for the third but resists after the sweeper swoops in to cut off the ball
leans forward to push this one wide of cover for a single
good solid push off the front foot to a full ball, straight to cover
chases a full and wide one in the air wide of backward point, all safe in the end and the sweeper covers good ground to cut the ball off in the deep
back of a length this time, Akmal waits on it and dabs to third man
full ball, 141ks, swings off the seam and it beats Akmal as he pushes away from the body with minimal footwork, thats a good ball from Fernando
short this time and Akmal stays back to force the ball wide of gully
good straight ball, Younis punches straight but Fernando cuts it off
starts off with a wide short ball and Akmal absolutely tonks that off the back foot, picking the gap at extra cover and two fielders cannot cut the ball off

similar ball, wide but perhaps a tad bit fuller, and this time it yields a wicket! Akmal stays back and looks to hammer the ball through the off side but its quicker and rises up and he gets a thin nick through to a gleeful Sangakkara
full outside off stump and squirted into the off side
a tad wider and shorter and Malik cuts wide of backward point
another short ball and now its Younis' turn to perforate the off side
good ball, good length, just on off stump and he defends it back
full ball, no room to work with and so Younis gets over the ball in a hurry, gently dabbing the ball square on the off side and running hard
back of a length outside off, he gets up and drives to the off side

ah the wide slip was just removed and now Younis edges the ball to near where the man was! Fernando bends his back and produces a short ball that surprises Younis, who pushes at it and gets done by the pace and lift
good effort ball again, jumps up off the deck and Younis leaves

good short ball on the stumps springs up to get Younis all at sea, he starts to hook but then takes his eyes off the ball, which then splices off the middle of the bat and pops up but then drops safely in front of the fielders
full this time, Malik drives straight, the ball ricochets onto the stumps
short ball, and with no slip or gully in place Malik easily steers the ball down to third man for a single
good length and Younis watchfully defends to the off side
straighter ball nips back in off the seam and Younis pats it back
sees some room on offer and slaps the ball in the air over cover
well struck by Malik, he sees a wide ball and rolls the wrists very well, cutting very fiercely through point for four
walks across his stumps and flicks a full ball wide of midwicket
pitched up on off stump and thats pushed to the off side
short of a length just outside off, dabbed to the man at cover
firmly committed to the front foot, Malik pushes to an alert cover fielder
shorter one this time, gets Malik onto the toes and defending
stump-to-stump line, spot on the dime, and Malik can only defend
full again just outside off stump, Malik drops his head and defends stoically to round off the first maiden of the innings, very well bowled by Fernando
starts pressing forward but goes back and slices the ball to point
just back of a length, seam-up, and Younis defends to cover
stops a touch on Younis who adjusts and pushes wide of extra cover
length ball outside off, drops the wrists and dabs it to gully
good shot, presses forward and pushes down to mid-off
sluggish now, presses forward but no timing and Mathews collects
pitches it up and this time he pushes gently to extra cover
firmly defends a full ball off the front foot and cover swoops in
gone this time! Fernando lands a good short of a length ball around off stump that forces Malik onto the back foot, the ball gets some extra lift and takes the edge
banged in again but its a tad wide and so Umar gets off the mark immediately by forcing the ball down to third man for one
short ball, Younis gets airborne and rides the bounce to safely drop the ball down in front of the off-side cordon
pulls a short ball from about off stump, not timed to perfection but Younis won't mind because its wide of midwicket and got enough legs on it to reach the ropes
full on middle and off, he stretches forward and turns it to leg

aha, there's some poor calling and Younis has to go! Slower ball, middle and leg, drifting in, Younis comes forward and on-drives the ball down the ground, he calls for the quick single but its a poor decision as Thushara runs in from mid-on, collects in a flash and knocks down the stumps with Younis well short of the crease
presses well forward and plays the ball to the off side
pitches it up a foot outside off, he gets well forward and leaves

slides down the pads, Umar is late on the attempted clip, the ball grazes his front leg and balloons up to the leg side, after taking an inside edge, the bowler runs to his right to field as Sangakkara appeals
bad ball, short and wide and duly hammered to the deep point ropes
short ball just goes over the stumps, Fawad ducks and sways
full on middle and off, brings it back in and Fawad defends
back of a length but too straight and thats turned to deep square

edged but it doesn't carry to slip! This one is full and lures Umar onto the front foot, pushing at it with hard hands, the ball kisses the edge but lands in front of Jayawardene and then rolls away behind Sangakkara
full again, going across Fawad who reaches out and edges past slip
shorter ball down the pads, Umar shuffles and tucks it away
tossed up wide of the pads, gets some sharp turn and bounces and beats Sangakkara
there's the doosra, pitching middle and leg and breaking away to surprise Umar who has to adjust in a hurry and stab at the ball to keep it off the stumps
flatter ball turns into the pads and Umar knifes it to square leg
slower ball tossed up wide of off stump, Fawad drives past cover
lands outside leg stump, Umar presses well forward to try and smother the turn, then spots the doosra and defends back to Murali
too wide and Umar easily goes back to cut wide of backward point
starts off full and straight and Umar watchfully defends the ball
a bit wider, gently starting to drift back in and no shot offered this time
comes onto the front foot early and then adjusts the wrists to ensure the ball stays  low and runs wide of gully
full ball outside off stump which Fawad pushes straight to cover
holds back the length, Fawad reaches out and dabs it to point
full outside off stump, angling away, and Fawad shoulder arms
flat outside leg stump and Umar manages to get a faint bit of wood on the ball and it so fine that the man in the deep cannot get to it, crucial runs to ease the nerves
tossed up on middle and leg and he gets forward to defend

oh thats exceptional work from Jayawardene at slip! Murali tosses it up, slowing the pace, pitches it around middle stump and turns it away from Umar who pushes at it, the ball takes the edge but it flies hard and low to Jayawardene's right, so not a catch but then before the ball can run away Jayawardene flips it back to Sangakkara and they appeal but Steve Davis shakes his head, not going upstairs, and replays indeed show Umar was safely home
flat on leg stump, worked with an inside edge wide of leg slip
flatter and shorter and Umar defends off the back foot
slower one, tossed up on the stumps, dabbed away for a couple
full outside off, Fawad walks into the shot and drives down the ground
full outside off stump and Umar leaves it alone
walks across his stumps before the ball is bowled, Mathew sees him and drops the ball short, Umar is cramped as he tries to get over the ball but manages to work it wide of midwicket
full and angling away from Fawad who shoulders arms
hits a good length and Fawad stabs at the ball in defence
a wider ball this time and he gets the back leg across, cutting the ball between cover and point for a single to retain the strike
tossed up invitingly, Fawad gets a stride forward and defends
a bit shorter and Fawad gets back to force the ball to extra cover
slower ball, middle and leg, jabs it to the on side in a hurry
flat outside leg stump, not much turn, Umar nudges off the pads

floated up wide of off stump, Fawad gets excited and flashes the bat at it, hit very but mistimes it and pops it up toward Fernando at short third man, then drops and spins away from him and runs away for four
tossed up outside the line, he tries a sweep but can't connect
full outside off stump and Umar lunges at it, defending to point
hops up and smartly turns a short ball past midwicket for one
short of a length on the stumps, Fawad gets tall and plays it down
stays back and and punches the ball to short cover
had him in some bother there, held back the length and slowed the pace, Fawad was early into the push and had to remove a hand to keep the ball down
fuller this time, Fawad pushes to cover but cannot pick up a run
flat outside leg stump, too full and Umar sweep past leg slip
flights it wide of off stump and gets sharp turn, Fawad leaves it be
holds back the length but Fawad stretches well forward to defend
thats ever wider and the umpire gets into the act now
comes onto the front foot and pushes the ball to point
continues to flight it invitingly wide of off stump, no shot offered
now he plays a shot, cutting the ball down to deep point for one

big shout from the bowler and wicketkeeper but that ball was marginally outside the leg stump, Mathews held back the length and rapped a shuffling Fawad's pads but replays show it did indeed pitch outside the line of impact
hits a length outside leg stump again and this time he flicks a single
much fuller and Umar comes onto the front foot, getting an outside edge down to third man
lands on middle and leg and angles across Fawad who doesn't commit much to the front foot and just taps the ball to the off side
now he gets a step down the track, looking to make room, but again just drives straight to the packed off-side field
still Fawad continues to struggle to pierce the gaps, just plants the front foot gingerly forward and pushes the ball to cover
flights up a doosra on middle and leg, Umar gets an inside edge
flat on the pads and he gets a single toward square leg
drifts onto the pads and he sweeps uneasily to the leg side
sharp turn, lands outside leg stump and spins away, beats Sangakkara and leg slip fumbles too
again drifts onto the pads, this time he plays with soft hands and beats the gap between leg slip and square leg, always urges the second and gets it too
regular offbreak, Umar comes well forward and defends
waits for spin and then eases the ball to the off side for one
hits a good length and he fails to beat the field
fuller ball sucks him forward and the beats the edge, just
full and straight and Umar cocks the wrists to try and manufacture a single to the leg side but struggles for timing and the bowler collects

edged and dropped by Sangakkara! Mathews rolls his fingers over the seam and sprays it a bit wide, Umar has a flash and gets an edge that flies to Sangakkara's right but he cannot hold on as he dives, just gets a glove on it and parries the ball to the leg side
gets back and works the ball away for a sharp single

hello, thats a smart catch by Mathews to go with a useless shot from Fawad! Fawad comes out of his crease like a maniac, Mathews sees him and holds back the length and draws a top-edged pull, the ball pops up toward midwicket but Mathews call for it, never taking his eyes off the ball, and then dives full length to pluck a beauty
on the stumps and Umar picks up a single, good use of the wrists
full on the stumps and he clips it in the air past midwicket
full and flat aiming for leg stump and thats clipped to Murali
slower ball, just holds it back in the air a fraction longer and gets some dip into Umar who waits and flicks toward midwicket
slower ball, not much turn, Afridi looks to drive to the on side but ends up pushing the ball to extra cover
lovely ball, the doosra! Pitches middle and off, lures Umar forward, then goes on past the bat as Sangakkara collects and whips off the bails
too straight and Afridi gets across his stumps, smartly picking the ball off his pads with a deft tickle to the fine leg boundary

out comes the Afridi slog, sauntering down the track, eyes looking toward Peshawar, feet headed toward Galle, head turned toward Pluto, and the result is a thick outside edge that evades a diving Sangakkara and finds the third man ropes
beaten outside off stump, gentle slower ball, well bowled
full and straight, on the seam and thats watchfully defended
again Afridi walks down the track and throws the bat at ball, slashing a top edge over gully and it lands safely, some hustling gets him back for the second
walks outside off stump and clips the ball to deep square leg
good shot, comes out and makes room and collects the ball on the full, clubbing it very hard and straight past the stumps
shorter ball on middle and leg spins away from Afridi who makes room and turns the bat face, steering it very fine wide of Sangakkara for four more
much slower, tossed up on middle and leg, Afridi pushes to the off side and there's a fumble from Tharanga so they hustle back for the risky second
lands on about leg stump and he defends it back to Murali
another slow ball outside leg, turns in and Afridi pushes to point
tossed up on the stumps, Umar gets in line to defend
throws the bat at a full and wide one, ball just skims past the edge

another carefree slog to a full and wide one and when he hits them that hard they often do go for four, as Fernando in the deep finds out, he runs in from deep cover and then looks on as the ball drops and spins away from him and goes to the ropes
flashes and flashes hard and picks up one to third man
tries a short ball but Umar plays it very well, riding the bounce and playing with soft hands to drop it well safe of Sangakkara and get four to third man
very wide and needs to be smacked, he gets bat on it but Kapugedera gets a finger on it, then his eyes close and he misfields it
slower ball on the dime, Afridi doesn't move his feet and pushes and gets beaten
slower ball tossed up, he takes it on the full and paddles it fine
good shot and placement, gets across and dabs it wide and Tharanga at deep point slides to save a single
spins away, Umar gets room and slaps it past cover
tossed up on the stumps, Afridi makes room and advances but then has to adjust and push the ball to cover

gone right through him! Murali holds back the length and slips in a straighter one that beats Afridi as he goes back and pushes down the wrong line, the ball kisses the top of leg stump and then Murali blows sweet nothings to send back Afridi, which he doesn't like and in return tells him the rendezvous point as he storms off
doosra on leg stump, breaks away and Razzaq defends it back

leans into a half-volley and square-drives through the off side, runs hard to get the second and then gets a third as Sangakarra fumbles and then gives up overthrows as the ball hits Razzaq's feet and ricocheted, Sangakkara protests with the batsman and umpire and doesn't look too pleased  ... after a chat they all decided on two
full on off stump and he eases the ball to cover
another touch shot, committed to the front foot, easing it to backward point
still he cannot find the gap, pushing the ball to the off side
serves up a full toss but Umar can't even put that away, looks to clip it but the bat turns in his hand and Kulasekara collects, then fumbles so he does get a single
beaten this time as he gets up and feels for a length ball
flat outside the pads, looks to turn it fine but can't connect well
slower, flighted up and dips late, Umar clears the front leg and flicks
flat ball outside leg stump, brushes the pads and runs fine
creates room and drives down the ground past mid-on, struck very firmly and it beats the fielder and makes its acquaintance with the long-on boundary
floats it outside leg stump again and now Umar sweeps wide of square leg, runs hard and gets two that raises Pakistan's 200
slower ball, no turn, lands outside leg and Umar works it away
slower ball, split-fingered stuff, but too straight and Umar nudges it off his pads for a single that brings up a maiden ODI half-century, and a very good one at that
bangs in a short ball, Razzaq rolls the wrists and pulls fine
now the confidence is showing! Clears the front leg and tees off with a lovely pull over midwicket, hit very high in the air and it clears the boundary
full ball this time as he aims for the yorker, doesn't quite pull it off and Umar slashes a one-handed drive to the off side, then vents his frustration
short ball down the leg side, Umar starts getting across his stumps and then sort of ducks low, checking the pull to flick if wide of square leg for four, top shot
the reply is a yorker on the stumps which he jams out well
bad ball, very wide down the leg side and Sangakkara fumbles
fuller, spins back in from middle and off, Razzaq goes back and pushes at it and the inside edge balloons up wide of square leg
take that! Umar is on song, just using his feet and lofting Murali straight back down the ground for half a dozen

now you take that, says Murali! Umar again waltzes out but this time swings across the line and misses the ball and hears the sound of timber, after which Murali is right up there in his ear with directions to the dressing room and what sightseeing to do in Dambulla
tossed up on middle and off and Naved defends watchfully
again gets well forward and defends
same stuff, plants the front leg forward but cant beat the field
takes a reverse-swinging full toss and punches it to extra cover
clears the front leg and drills this one down to mid-off where Murali returns a direct hit to the wrong end so Pakistan are safe
good placement, just frees the arms and bisects cover and point with a lovely slap in the air
mistimes a full toss, pulling it wide of mid-on down to the deep
short ball gets him onto the toes, plays it gently down to point
full ball just outside off stump, nearly a yorker, just manages to get the toe end of the bat on the ball and squirt it away and runs back for the second, good work
starts off full and straight, a low full toss, but Razzaq just pats it back
low full toss outside off stump, Razzaq kneels down and jams it out to the off side, didn't time it very well at all
now there's a shot! Vintage Razzaq hit, clears the front leg and smashes the low full toss over mid-off for a straight six, excellent hitting
makes room and steers this one to Mathews on the off side
walks across his stumps, Thushara sees him coming and fires it full and wide of off stump, Naved rolls the wrists but cannot connect
slower ball, very full just outside off stump, Naved pushes forward in an attempt to steer if fine but misses and so thats two dots in a row
full outside off stump, Razzaq kneels down and drives down to long-off, calling for two immediately, Murali harries in and keeps them to a single
stays his ground and flashes at a length ball, resulting in an inside edge behind the stumps, Naved looks around but Razzaq says just run
slower ball, a bit too short, Razzaq waits and cuts well but Kapugedera gets a touch on it at point, very well stopped
now its Naved's turn to get it on! Walks down the track nonchalantly and pumps that ball rows back over long-on for six, super shot
attempted yorker this time, squeezed out to the off side
full and straight and he jams it to extra cover
fulltoss on leg stump, Razzaq gets a leading edge, which falls safely in front of long off
yorker on leg stump, gets some bat onto it and takes a single to extra cover
swinging yorker, Razzaq makes room, too much, and misses it outside off
inches short of being a yorker, Razzaq makes room and hits, but can't beat extra cover
length ball, on leg stump, Rana goes for a big shot, gets an inside edge to short fine
another yorker, Razzaq manages just an inside edge to short fine, good over, just five off
full ball outside off, driven hard but can't beat cover, dot ball
that's Razzaq of the old, slower ball, picks it early, and lofts it over cow corner, what a clean hit
length ball on off, chipped over cover, easy two
makes room too early, Kula slips in a full and wide delivery, well bowled
fulltoss on off stump, sliced just over cover, and they rush back for two - safely
and he's gone, good catch by Mahela at extra cover, it is a fulltoss drilled towards Mahela who dives forward to give Kula his first wicket today
fulltoss outside off, and he misses because he has backed away too early
slower ball outside off stump, beats an attempted big hit
full ball on the stumps, driven down the ground, just one run
slower ball, short of a length, beats Aamer, Sanga fumbles but they don't go through for the bye
short ball again, slower ball, steered down to third man
full ball, on off stump, tries to drive it down the ground, but goes straight to the bowler, another superb over by Thushara
pitched up on a length just outside off and he dabs it to point
clean hit and Naved just stands there and says go fetch! Clears the front leg and with that nice big backlift just thumps the full ball over the umpire's head
attempted yorker outside off stump, good slower ball too, flays at it and misses

its a top-edge, a real miscue at that, but excellent placement! Naved walks across his stumps and tries to flick away a full toss but gets a leading edge that spirals over gully and drops safely between two fielders
short of a length, Aamer backs away and steers it to gully
another good hit at the death from Naved, planting himself across a low full toss and clubbing the ball over a backpedaling wide long-on's head
goes full and wide, searching for the yorker outside off stump, Aamer makes room and throws the bat at ball but cannot connect so thats a dot ball
full and straight, Aamer shuffles and tries to flick the ball but mistimes it and it dribbles back to the bowler
this time he gets a single, scooping it off the toe end past cover
and thats the highest score in Dambulla, courtesy a meaty straight drive from Naved down the ground to long-on
another full ball, Naved drives past extra cover and chances the fielder's arm for the second, had the ball found the stumps Naved was a goner
reaches out and slices a full ball in the air over gully, drops in no man's land and Naved has lifted Pakistan to a very pleasing total

inn2.comm: swing first ball with Aamer pitching it up outside off stump, Tharanga chases loosely and gets beaten
short of a length on off stump, Tharanga defends from the crease
similar length but outside off and Tharanga steers it past gully
short ball outside leg stump, spears into Jayawardene who manages to work it off the hips with one hand off the bat, so he's off the mark
full and wide, hits the pitch and swings away and no shot offered
back of a length again, he defends while covering off stump and squirts the ball into the gap near midwicket
starts off full with some shape from just outside off stump, so narrowly hitting the bails after a leaden-footed Tharanga swipes across the line
stands upright again and just relies on his wrists and the speed off the bat, again not moving his feet much but just nudging the ball wide of midwicket
pitched up and thats the way to deal with them, just eases forward and punches through the line to beat extra cover, all along the turf
fuller and wider, wobbling off the seam and he leaves it be
drives with too much bottom hand and chops the ball to short cover
good length ball angling across, Tharanga pushes out in front of the pad and the balls skims off the edge and rolls to backward point
thats a good length to land the ball, not much room to work with so Jayawardene defends and responds to the call for a single as the ball trickles to the off

slants down the pads, there are two sounds as Tharanga pushes down the wrong line, the ball clips the pad and ricochets to the off side and the decision from the umpire is correct as replays show the ball would have missed leg stump
there's a bouncer, 133ks, forcing Tharanga to duck
again Aamer strays onto the pads and Tharanga glances a couple
pushes at the ball and squirts it wide of gully, the outfield is fast and thats four more to Tharanga
swing and a miss from Tharanga, just reaching away from the body to one pitched up in search of the edge
good ball, hits the deck off a length and beats Jayawardene's bat through late movement, he went back and felt for it and nearly edged it
more watchful stuff from Jayawardene, defending off the front foot
good shot, uses his feet gently and collects the ball on the volley, just rolling the wrists and going wide of mid-on, thats a cool little shot from Jayawardene
fuller in length and it draws an inside edge as Jayawardene pushes at the ball off the front foot, the slight deviation drew the little sound of wood
back of a length this time, Jayawardene gets across to cover off stump and rolls the wrists to try and get a single to the leg side but ends up playing it back
thats a Jayawardene special, taking the full ball on the rise and going past extra cover and then standing to admire his handiwork
back of a length and he pushes it straight to point
commits himself two-thirds forward, as he often does, and then pushes the ball to point again
starts to walk out, Aamer bounces him, its called wide for height
short of a length into the body, he gets tall and defends it back
too straight and Tharanga turns it to short fine leg
on the pads and he on-drives the ball to midwicket
edged but where's slip? Good ball, loose shot, forcing Tharanga to feel for it but there's no one catching and the result is a fortuitous boundary to third man
on middle and leg, Jayawardene gets across and glances it fine, what with fine leg up thats four more to the total
now he goes downtown, driving the ball on the rise over mid-off
slower ball, the cutter off the seam, pitches on a length and beats the outer edge and then doesn't carry to the wicketkeeper
defends a short of a length delivery to backward point
fuller in length and Jayawardene defends to backward point
good length ball, Jayawardene thinks about turning it to the on side but adjusts to defend to the off side
again he commits himself half forward and then uses the pace of the ball, pushing very late and beating the man at backward point
back of a length, hint of shape back in and he dabs to point
gets back and tries to flicks a short ball but Aamer runs across
turns a fuller ball off the pads toward Afridi at square leg
full outside off stump, angling back in, square-driven to point
swivels and pulls a short ball down the pads out to deep fine leg
beats him first ball with swing back into the left-hander, hits the seam and jags back in very close to the top of off stump, cutting Tharanga nearly in half
pitches on leg stump and swings away, Tharanga is nearly squared up but manages to push the ball down toward mid-off
a touch too short and Jayawardene capitalises, using the pace to go back and whip the ball past midwicket and the fast outfield does the rest
better ball, fuller length and Tharanga defends it back
he's not hitting them all that hard but Tharanga is moving along well, once again he pushes at the ball gently and bisects the gap behind point to post the fifty
pitched up outside off, seams in, Tharanga defends
hits a good length and angles across Jayawardene, who pushes at the ball and is beaten by the shape
straighter ball, clipped off the stumps to square leg where Umar collects and has a shy but cannot hit the stumps at Tharanga's end
gets across and clips a length ball toward midwicket
short of a length outside off, Tharanga stands tall and forces the ball square on the off side, again whats notable is how he plays softly and uses the pace
too full and wide and Jayawardene square-drives on the rise between two men posted on the off side, good to watch
good length and he drops his head to defend watchfully
on the pads and well played wide of square leg a single
a bit of room outside off stump is all Jayawardene needs to see before he frees the arms and brings the bat down like a rapier, back-cutting rather well for four
full on leg stump now and he turns it wide of midwicket
slips out a wide full toss, basically the slower ball gone wrong, Jayawardene looks surprised but  then waits and dabs the ball toward gully
pitched up, Jayawardene drives straight to mid-on
slower ball outside off and he dabs it late for a single
tossed up on middle and off, Jayawardene coolly rolls the wrists to knock the ball wide of midwicket
fuller ball, middle and off, again he clips the ball away
flatter ball pitches well outside the pads and slides on
slower, more air, pitches middle and off and Tharanga defends
well this won't do much for Pakistan, Tharanga comes out and pushes the ball to mid-off where Fawad fumbles the ball and urges the wrath of Afridi
flatter ball, middle and leg, turned to the on side
floats it outside off stump and Tharanga has a go, square-driving with plenty of bottom hand and beating the man at backward point
slower ball, pitched up and Tharanga drives past covers
takes a step down and pushes on the rise to the man at cover
shorter ball on middle and leg, Jayawardene tries to work the to the leg side but doesn't get the desired timing
back to full and Jayawardene drives handsomely to mid-off
slower ball outside off, guided smartly down to third man
full outside off, onto the front foot he comes, dabbing to point
short ball this time, Jayawardene makes room to cut but the bounce draws a top edge that falls well in front of short third man
slower legspinner on the stumps, eased past mid-on for one
a touch full and he leans into it with a sumptuous cover drive
straighter one, worked away out to the deep, soft hands there
slower one, drifting in from middle and leg, Jayawardene turns it in the air and it doesn't carry near the man at midwicket
standard topspinner, much fuller and he defends off the front foot

decent ball but again thats just the way Tharanga has played today, he doesn't commit himself all the way forward but just feels for the ball, gently turning the face, and with no slip he knows its a productive shot to play
fuller ball with some shape back in and he drives to cover
walks into a full ball and drives hard but to the man at mid-off
good length ball which he defends watchfully to the off side
how did that miss? Thats a lovely slower ball, out the back of the hand, pitches full and lures Jayawardene forward, beats the bat and somehow the top of off too
the frustration shows on the batsman, who plays a crude swipe to one on the stumps, gets it down to short fine leg who fumbles slightly
flat and full on the stumps, clipped just wide of midwicket for one
slower ball outside leg stump, slight drift and Tharanga waits before dabbing the ball toward short fine leg for a single
first six of the innings, and timely too given the Powerplay, with Jayawardene planting the front foot forward and slog-sweeping against the turn over midwicket
now he just comes forward and knocks a single down the ground
gets back and steers the ball to short third man
a tad short again and he chops the ball to Malik on the off side
flighted on middle and off, Jayawardene brushes the ball to leg
gently tossed up on a length and Tharanga has to defend
quicker ball, shorter too, pitches and spins sharply down the pads as Tharanga walks across and tries a glance, there's some noise and Akmal fumbles it ... was it a catch?
comes onto the front foot and pushes the ball away
gets back and punches this one away
slower ball flighted outside off stump, making him come and chase it, he plays a loose shot but again the ball just doesn't carry to the fielder
and there's his half-century, comes out and pushes the ball down the ground, well played Jayawardene
flat on the stumps, goes back and nudges it to square leg

now there's an imploring appeal from Akmal and Afridi as a full, flighted delivery outside leg stump beats the sweep and hits the shoe, they are up in appeal but Steve Davis shakes his head, replays suggest there was a slight under edge
too short and he pulls it over midwicket
fuller ball, much slower too and he clips it for a single
and now Tharanga raises his tenth ODI half-century, easing forward and driving the ball to extra cover for one, a good innings from him and very timely too
gets forward and punches the ball through the off side for one
flat ball spins down the pads and he can't connect on it
gets across and plays a reverse paddle to short third man
width outside off, cuts and misses, Akmal fumbles
tossed up outside off stump, gently pushes wide of point
flatter ball, he goes back and forces the ball away square
short of a length outside off and he steers it wide of point for one
skips out and clips the ball off his pads for an easy single
deft little late cut wide down to third man, riding the bounce
pitches just outside leg and he whips it away to the deep
starts walking down and so Razzaq smartly drops it in short, forcing Jayawardene to get up and fend the ball down to the off side behind square
full outside leg stump, beats the flick and rolls off the pads for one
spins down the pads and a wide is called
better ball, the offspinner on a length and he defends
big shout for lbw as Jayawardene reaches out to outside off stump and tries a sweep but misses, the ball strikes him flush on the pad but he had gone a long ways across to try and reach the ball
quicker ball on middle and leg and he plays it to midwicket
much slower, good stuff, dips on him and he has to defend
again drifts down the leg side and raps him high on the flap
well thats a chancy shot but he's pulled it off, exposing all the stumps as the ball turns back in and then dabbing it very, very fine to short third man who misfields
gives him the charge looking to go inside-out over cover but only manages an inside edge to the leg side that results in a single
good ball, back of a length on leg stump and he defends it
he too makes room and exposes the stumps to dab a short ball wide of backward point, Aamer in the deep runs across to cut it off
back of a length just outside off and he dabs it square
drives hard at a full ball and gets an inside edge that gets stuck in his pads, then the ball bobs out by which time Tharanga has set off for the quick single
back of a length just outside leg, Tharanga drives to the off
kneels across the stumps and sweeps with the turn, the ball kisses the top edge and balloons down to fine leg
quicker ball on middle and leg, worked to the man at midwicket
gets cheeky again, late-cutting this one to Afridi at short third
another big shout as a faster, flatter one spins back in and catches a shuffling Jayawardene plumb in front of the stumps but Asoka de Silva spots the inside edge
full on the stumps and he comes out to drive a single
gets across again and nudges the ball to midwicket for one
back of a length and Jayawardene waits for the ball to come onto him before dabbing it square on the off side for an easy single
fuller one and he drives it with little footwork past cover-point
good shot, he knew mid-off was up in the circle and gave Razzaq the charge, hitting crisply on the rise over mid-off's head for four
leans into a pleasing cover drive but cannot pierce the field
starts walking down so Razzaq fires it wide but a little too much
good bit of seam bowling from Razzaq, pitches on the seam and wobbles and Jayawardene dabs the ball toward backward point
another neat little guide down to third man, using the width
slow ball down the pads and he eases it away for a single
fired outside off stump and Tharanga picks up a single past cover
much slower delivery, tossed up outside the pads, dips and beats Jayawardene's attempted flick
and the reply from Jayawardene is a classy reverse sweep with the spin over short third man's head
throws it up slower and he on-drives it down the ground
throws this one down the pads and he sweeps a single
back of a length outside leg and turned toward midwicket
good short ball now, hits the deck hard and angles across Tharanga who arches his back and raises the bat to let the ball go on
clever slower ball, on a fuller length, Tharanga doesn't move much as he opens the face to steer the ball but is beaten
short of a length and he swipes it past square leg for one
low full toss outside off, square-driven for a single
full down the pads and he clips the ball to deep square leg
tossed up full and he punches the ball to extra cover
gets across to cover the stumps and sweeps very well
slow ball, floated up outside leg stump, clipped away off the toes
tossed up on middle and off and he drives it straight past Ajmal for a single that raises the 150 to plenty of cheer
a tad short and he transfers the weight to cut it away for one
floated outside off, he gets across and paddles it expertly
bangs in a short ball outside off stump which Jayawardene pulls in front of square, doing well to roll the wrists
fuller on off stump, Tharanga pushes it down to long-off
slower ball, fuller, Jayawardene spots it and gently drops it at his feet, looks up at Tharanga who has set off but then shoos him back in time
smacked! Jayawardene has been excellent today and he moves into the nineties with another effortless inside-out drive over extra cover, making room
another slower ball, attempted yorker, dips on off stump but this man is in such form he just opens the face and dabs a couple to third man
speared down the pads and he gets a leg bye to square leg
short ball and he pulls it out to the deep midwicket sweeper
now short outside off and he cuts out to the deep cover sweeper
much slower and tossed up on middle and off, bunted for a single
spins off a short length and Tharanga goes back to slap it past cover
goes back and across and moves to 98 with a punch to mid-on
spins in from leg stump and he turns it to the on side
pitched up outside off stump and he drives straight to extra cover
back of a length, deviates off the seam to beat the bat
comes half forward and pushes at the ball, getting an outer edge safely down to third man, streaky shot to take him to 99
wide ball, loose full toss outside off, slashes and misses
attempted yorker, slower ball too, chipped down to long-off
and listen to the roar as Jayawardene brings up his 11th century in ODIs, just staying deep in the crease and pulling the ball down in front of square
spins back in off a short length to beat a cramped cut, close!
drifts down the pads and he brushes it for a single
flat on leg stump and knocked down to mid-on, where Younis collects and fires a throw back to Malik who cannot collect and the result is overthrows
too fine and he glances it with an inside edge to fine leg
spins back in outside off stump as Jayawardene makes room to cut, he misses, Kamran fumbles
tossed up on the stumps and he pushes it back loosely
flat on the stumps and he works it away down the pads
looped up outside off stump and Tharanga reaches out to drag it back across the line to Afridi
flips it up generously on middle and off and he drives down the ground
backs away to the fifth stump and dabs a short ball past gully
short ball down leg stump and Jayawardene picks it up easily, pulling the ball past midwicket to the boundary
tosses a legbreak which he defends to the off side, the runner and Tharanga have a stumble but get the single in the end
tosses it up and he drives it back to Malik
wide ball down leg stump, this time Kamran collects it
full on the pads, easily clipped out to deep midwicket
uses his feet to collect on the full, flicking past mid-on
slower ball stops on him as it dips but he drives to midwicket
full ball drifts into Tharanga and he punches sweetly to extra cover
waits to see if  this one spins in, it doesn't and he on-drives
makes room and drives inside-out over covers with fluency
full and flat, no air at all, driven on the move to long-off for two
flashes at this one and gets beaten by the turn
fizzes it wide and he thuds it down to long-off and thats the 200
slower ball, bit of turn, nudged to midwicket watchfully
steers a full and wide ball in the air over cover for a couple
tossed up and he just plods it defensively to the off side
tries to sweep one tossed up outside off but can't connect

a wicket! Ajmal comes back and snaps a double-century stand by trapping Tharanga on the back foot as he pushes at the ball but on replays that looked a bit unlucky as the ball was hitting him outside off stump, unfortunate for Tharanga who played well
reaches out and sweeps first ball from outside off stump, connecting well and placing it into the gap
tries to work the ball to the on side and gets a leading edge
comes forward and pushes the ball away
nothing at all to worry them here, Jayawardene for the umpteenth time opens the face and steers the ball down to third man for a single
fuller ball with some shape back in, Sangakkara stabs at it and gets an inside edge just wide of square leg
swipes across the line to a full ball and somehow picks the gap at square leg, beating one man chasing and one coming across, not bad for an inside edge
and he falls with a tired shot! Razzaq hits the deck, Jayawardene once more tries that inside-out drive over extra cover but only succeeds in ballooning a catch that settles in the fielder's hands
gets forward and he pushes the ball to mid-on for one
back of a length and Samaraweera defends off the back foot
tossed up, comes onto the front foot and hits to extra cover

hello whats this? Pakistan are fighting back, its a good ball from Ajmal, tosses up the doosra to Samaraweera who shuffles as he looks to clip the ball to on side but only ends up chipping a return catch to the bowler
tossed up and he defends straight to silly point
flat on the pads and he clips it past short leg and midwicket, good placement to open his innings
a tad flatter outside off and he late-cuts it to third man
good ball, spins past the outer edge as he feels for it
back of a length, dabbed to the off side, sets off, hesitates, the man at cover hits the stumps and its referred upstairs but Kandamby has made it safely
full on middle and off, turned delicately past square leg
walks out and across and whips the ball from outside off stump out to deep square leg, thats an authoritative shot
back of a length on the stumps, bunted toward midwicket
too short and wide and he slaps it past a diving backward point
walks into his shot, just pressing the ball to cover and then the fielder flings the ball down toward square leg
tossed up wide, he makes room and slices it past point for two
tossed up outside off, gets some sharp turn, shoots away and Kandamby opens the face to guide that behind point for a single
short of a length outside off, tries to chop it behind point, gets an under edge on the bounce to the keeper
coming round the wicket and firing it down the leg side, given a wide
tossed up just outside off, slog-swept all along the ground to deep midwicket for a single
threw it up on middle and off, closes the face and works it to midwicket
slightly short outside off, rocks back and punches that between point and cover for a single
short of a good length just on the off, rocks back and defends it towards the bowler
darted back in from a good length outside off, waits for it and it comes in more than he expected, drops it with soft hands into the off side
back of a length outside off, mistimes a pull back to the bowler, was hoping to slap it past Aamer in the direction of mid-on
slightly short outside off, held its line this time, dabs it just at the right time to third man for a single
a touch fuller and was trying to cut it back into the left hander, Sanga got a good stride forward, came outside the line and defended it with bat close to pad
short of a good length on the off, pushed wide of midwicket on the back foot for a single
flat and full on middle and off and he plays a sweet clip shot
flatter ball and pushes off the back foot to cover, sets off and its looking risky but the throw cannot find its mark
fuller ball gets him onto the front foot and defending
comes forward and defends again
short outside off stump and he hammers a pull just past mid-on and even the sweeper cannot get there in time it was so powerfully hit
short outside off and he now crashes it wide of deep extra cover
full on middle and off, no swing at all, clipped toward mid-on
pushes at it and gets an inside edge onto the pad this time
short of a length, stands tall and works the ball across the line to midwicket where the ball goes right through Jamshed's legs, what terrible fielding
fuller on leg stump, beats the bat, they all ask the question, Steve Davis shakes his head as he reckons it was high but thats a very good appeal
tries to latch onto a short ball and the top edge pops up toward midwicket where the fielder is not alert and fails to pull off a dive, had he it may have been a chance
short of a length outside off and steered down to third man for one
clean pick-up shot, just backing himself to swing across the line to a fullish ball and goes wide of midwicket and mid-on for four
pressed onto the back foot this time, he dabs the ball to third man
too short and Sangakkara gets right over the ball, pulling through midwicket to raise Sri Lanka's 250
takes a step forward, Razzaq tries to hold back the length but Sangakkara still manages to dab a single into the off side
rolls the wrists and back-cuts a short ball to backward point
hops back and across to a shorter ball and drops the gentle wrists, easing the ball safely wide of the wicketkeeper down to third man to keep strike
bounces him down leg stump over the right shoulder
short ball down the hips and Kandamby brushes it for a single
again a tad too straight and he shuffles it to midwicket, the throw hits the stumps and they get a single
good length just about on off stump and he defends it back
speared onto the toes, flicked out to the sweeper for a single
another stray short ball down the leg side and wide is called
gets back again and steers the ball down to third man for one
tosses it up outside off and Kandamby plays it to gully
good placement, plays the same shot but bisects two fielders
fuller in length to commit Kandamby forward in defence
again too wide so Kandamby cuts and the ball goes straight through backward point, the fielding has been pretty shoddy today from Pakistan
floated up even wider, no shot offered because thats a wide
similar stuff, gets back and dabs the wide ball to gully
full and slower on the pads, nudged past midwicket
timber! Aamer pitches it fuller and straighter, Kandamby swings across the line, misses, and the ball pegs back the off stump
shorter in length, angles across nicely and he leaves
similar ball and this time Kapugedera has a flirt and misses
a bit fuller yet still in that channel that angles across in an attempt to induce a nick but now Kapugedera shoulders arms
even fuller this time and he drives loosely and misses
and again, pitches it up and again the batsman leaves
tossed up just around middle and leg stump and Sangakkara just sweeps it over square leg for four
sweeps again to a wider one, this time for a single
tosses it up and Kapugedera drives off the front foot, no power at all but he threads the gap at cover with superb timing and placement
this one spits and rips down the pads to Razzaq at short fine leg
flatter ball, still no turn, tucked toward mid-on for a single
floats it up just outside off and again he drives through cover
back of a length on middle and off, Kapugedera punches the ball off the back foot to mid-off and sets off and has to put in a proper dive to make his crease
short bouncer way down the leg stump, Sangakkara hooks and misses and the errant delivery even beats Kamran
and there it is, Sangakkara swings a full ball off his pads out to deep midwicket to seal the series, Sri Lanka's first success over Pakistan in ODIs at home
